text: RT @BucksCouncil: ⚠️#Floodalerts ⚠️ There are currently 3 @EnvAgencySE flood alerts in force in #NorthBucks https://t.co/p7uwzQxaQY https:/…

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable As it’s in England, this is a clear breech of farming rules for water.  We really need to be insisting on at least 5 months slurry & dirty water storage and cover crops, a good CS scheme would also really help

@SouthernWater @EnvAgency Perhaps he'd like to have a look at the back of the pumping station in Faulkners lane CT2 area and tell us what he's doing about the pool of sewage filling the stream #waterwednesday

urls.title: When to use NHS 111
urls.description: NHS 111 can help if you have an urgent medical problem and you’re not sure what to do.

text:
@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice ❓ If you think you may need A&E, contact NHS 111 First by phone or online at https://t.co/n9fCFO9EQD.

Contacting 111 First will help ensure people receive the right care in the right place in a timely, safe way.

⚠️ In an emergency, always dial 999.

👇 https://t.co/IbdVlrOHtF
@EnvAgency how do we get help?!  #StormChristoph #flooding we live at the side of this brook which will flood us if it gets any worse! PR44AJ https://t.co/kujdZVd1zS
@AnnaWeather @EnvAgency I have 26mm since Monday morning Anna.😊

urls.title: Flood Resilience and Response
urls.description: Flooding is an important issue and climate change is likely to increase the risk of flooding in the future. The council works closely with the Environment Agency and other partners e.g. United Utilities, in order to minimise the risk to people and property.

text:
If you live in a flood risk area, please check your flood plans and take precautions for possible flooding from the heavy and persistent rain forecast for Tameside.

Keep up to date with weather forecasts @MetOffice and advice from the @EnvAgency

https://t.co/iMMBJo2yUU https://t.co/wMJvXZTh0N

text:
@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice 📊 Our last #COVID19 update shows the number of first vaccine doses carried out across GM as of today: approx. 195.771.

Andy thanks all NHS staff, volunteers, and everyone involved in the collective effort.

🗣️ "The level of progress really has kicked on again this week."

👇 https://t.co/jnUL4mlMP7
RT @PoliceNorthwich: We’re currently supporting our colleagues from @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire and @EnvAgencyNW, evacuating a number o…

@austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Completely agree Charles - we need to retrofit the 'green' back into urban landscapes to attenuate surface water flooding in urban areas. Shoving storm water down Victorian combined overflows (polluting rivers with sewage) is not a good way forward.
@HuddersfieldTi2 @EnvAgencyYNE Thank you for this. We have teams out and I have passed this on. A team will attend and take action where needed.

text: @austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts You must be young! Much has changed - we have spent millions of our money to drain the hills from 1960s thru to 1980s. Climate change is intensifying storms and the impact gets more severe.

text:
@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice 📊 Here is the table of hospital admissions and bed occupancy across Greater Manchester, up to 18/19 January.

🗣️ “What we can see there is the effect of the third wave continuing to feed through in the numbers”, says Andy.

"At some point next week we will hit the peak."

👇 https://t.co/Jwf7IdOMrf

RT @FriendsLoxley: The River Loxley at ‘Rowell Bridge level recorder’ a few minutes ago. Swollen, turbulent, angry and still rising. Finger…

@austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Apologies Charles. Would be great to switch road drainage to green swales where possible deploying natural absorption of storm waters where possible (sustainable drainage systems - SuDS). Retrofit SuDS to avoid urban flooding, green our streets, absorb C, reduce urban heat - win!

@knutsfordchap @PoliceNorthwich @Go_CheshireWest @CheshireFire @EnvAgencyNW I was on the marina in 2019 when it reached 2.85m. The piles holding the marina were only 3m tall. Had it risen any higher it would have been lost. Even though the pile height was increased, you lose electricity & use of the facilities. People of advancing years are there too.

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service – your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

text:
Did you know that anyone transporting waste must have a valid waste carriers permit and they must also provide a waste transfer note which proves the waste has been transported and disposed of legally?

Search for permit holders on @EnvAgencyNW website: https://t.co/HXQ6Zjffkd https://t.co/xEHoV3Y8uR
